translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

I received Your Excellency’s letter 28, in response to mine of the 26th of last month, and regarding its content I must tell you that I am increasingly convinced that Your Excellency’s Municipal Chamber, although lacking, holds all responsibility upon Your Excellency, Your Excellency ad hoc to preside over an electoral board; furthermore, Your Excellency Your Excellency February 10th in which Your Excellency

From the attached copy Your Excellency will see Your Excellency Your Excellency Your Excellency

May God keep Your Excellency São Lourenço, March 1, 1840. Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães. Chief of Police of Boqueirão. Joaquim Francisco dos Santos Abreu.

Follow with all possible brevity.

Letter from the President of the Primary Board of the elections of March 1; received on the 2nd and replied on the same day. Secretariat of the Presidency of the Republic

To the citizen Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães, Chief of Police of Boqueirão. From the President of the Primary Board.
